chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: This document is a companion to the Gwydion &dylan; Maintainer's Manual. The Maintainer's Manual contains an overview of the compiler's overall design, and information about its use. This document, the &d2c; API Reference Manual, is simply a catalog and description of all the methods, classes and variables in &d2c;. In addition to the signature and overview, each method definition contains information about which variables and parameters are mutated. There may be some descriptions of algorithms in this document, but it is intended that that information be put in the Maintainer's Manual.
Each chapter comprises one library, and is broken down into subsections by module and then file.

Comments, corrections and additions are welcomed. This is intended to be a collaborative effort — your contributions are sorely needed. In particular, I'd like to ask that when you add or modify any definitions to &d2c;, that you add the documentation to this guide. The more people that work on this, the faster that it will get done.

sect1.title: Module c-representation

defdescription.para: This method returns true if the representation class can support a bottom value. (Eg, the immediate form for integers can't, but the full heap representation can.) A subclass of <c-representation> that represents arbitrary objects of unknown type..
A subclass of <c-representation> representing heap-allocated objects. I'm not sure how this differs from <general-representation> objects.

I think it might be useful in a case when an object needs to be heap allocated, but the type is known and doesn't necessarily need the full object representation — eg, to represent <pair>s with two words of RAM. I won't know for certain, though, until I learn more about &d2c;.
I believe this class represents unboxed values that may be larger than one machine word.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: This method sets all the nice globals described above.

defdescription.para: This method will look up *current-target* and try to set all the alignment- and representation-related global variables in this module. It is used to set the following variables:

dylan-variable-def.defsummary: Unknown.

defdescription.para: As far as I can tell, this is a dead/obsolete binding. There do not seem to be *any* references to this variable anywhere in the c-representation module, and it is not exported from the module. It's just dead code, which should be removed.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Compute the representations for a compile-time class.

defdescription.para: This method computes the representations of class by mutating the slots direct-speed-representation and direct-space-representation of the class parameter.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Compute a <c-data-word-representation> for a <cclass>.

defdescription.para: Computes a representation for class consistent with data-word-type. This method mutates the slots direct-speed-representation and direct-speed-representation of class.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Compute a <general-representation> for a <cclass>.

defdescription.para: This method sets the slots direct-speed-representation and direct-speed-representation of class to *general-rep*.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Pick a representation for a compile-time class.

defdescription.para: Based on the value of optimize-for, pick-representation will set either of the general-speed-representation or general-space-representation slots of class. It uses general-representation to select a representation.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Returns a representation for a compile-time class.

defdescription.para: This method returns a general representation for a compile-time class. It does not mutate any of its arguments.
This specialized method returns the direct representation of its type argument. It may mutate the slots direct-speed-representation and direct-space-representation of the object. type.base-class.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Return the representation of the compile-time class.

defdescription.para: This method returns either the direct-speed-representation or direct-space-representation slots of class; if they are unassigned it will set those slots and then return the appropriate value.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Return the representation of the compile-time class.

defdescription.para: This method reinvokes pick-representation on type.base-class, and returns that slot's direct-speed-representation or direct-space-representation; if they are unassigned it may set those slots and then return the appropriate value.

defdescription.para: This method returns *byte-char-rep*, first setting it if it is #f.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Returns the representation of compile-time integer types.

defdescription.para: Returns the appropriate representation for limited integer types. Does not mutate any slots.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Returns a representation of union types.

defdescription.para: This function merges all the representations in the members slot of type, to return the least general representation that can hold all possible legal values.
This method may modify the direct-{foo}-representation slots of the root types of the type-union tree.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Returns the minimal type that can contain any value in either of its arguments.

defdescription.para: This method returns a new representation that is more general than either of its arguments. It modifies neither of its arguments.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Returns a representation for a type not known at compile time.

defdescription.para: This method mutates none of its arguments.

sect1.title: Module utils
sect1.para: Unsurprisingly, this module is a grab-bag of various useful functions and methods the used by modules in the rest of the compiler. Some of this stuff is actually quite useful in contexts beyond writing a compiler, and should probably be moved into some of the common libraries rather than living in compiler base.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Pretty-print error messages.

defdescription.para: Used for error message printing. Turns each space in the control string into a conditional newline, and turns literal newlines into a mandatory newline and 2 space indent.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: A method that uses pretty-format.

defdescription.para: This method prints error messages using pretty-format. It works by shadowing the condition-format method defined on (<stream>, <string>).

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Print an object's classname to a stream.

defdescription.para: This print's thing's object-class's name to the stream. If the class is anonymous, the default representation of classes is printed to the stream. (This should never happen until &d2c; learns how to make anonymous classes.)

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Prints the address of an object

defdescription.para: Prints the hexadecimal address of object to the stream stream.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Used to print an object and its fields

defdescription.para: This method is a tool used to print the constituents of an object. The #rest argument is a list of symbols alternating with values — the symbols are used as the field names for the values.

dylan-variable-def.defsummary: Vector of English names for numbers.

defdescription.para: This vector contains the names that are prefixed by numbers less than a hundred — "thousand", "million", etc. It is used in the method integer-to-english.

dylan-variable-def.defsummary: Vector of the English tens units.

defdescription.para: This vector contains the names of multiples of ten — "twenty", "thirty", etc. It is used in the method integer-to-english.

dylan-variable-def.defsummary: Vector of English words for 0 to 20.

defdescription.para: This vector contains strings naming the integers from 0 to 20. It is used in the method integer-to-english .

dylan-variable-def.defsummary: Like $thousand-cardinals, except to name positions.

defdescription.para: This vector lists the ordinals for numbers bigger than 1000 — "millionth", "billionth" and so on. It is used in the method integer-to-english.

dylan-variable-def.defsummary: Like $ten-cardinals, except to name positions.

defdescription.para: This vector lists the ordinals for small integers from 0 to 20 — "zeroth", "first", etc. It is used in the method integer-to-english.

dylan-method-def.defsummary: Convert an integer to an English string.

defdescription.para: This method converts an <integer> object into the English string for the number it represents. If the keyword as: is set to #"ordinal", then the English string is the name of the n-th position; otherwise it is just the name of the number.
